intro: Vulneraria heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf vulneraria, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, ranging from linear to ovate, and its small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Vulneraria heterophylla is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
